chapter.title: Funding, citing, and anonymous usage statistics

section.title: Citing Pegasus in Academic Works
section.para: The preferred generic way to cite Pegasus is:

para.emphasis: Pegasus: a Framework for Mapping Complex Scientific Workflows onto Distributed Systems, Ewa Deelman, Gurmeet Singh, Mei-Hui Su, James Blythe, Yolanda Gil, Carl Kesselman, Gaurang Mehta, Karan Vahi, G. Bruce Berriman, John Good, Anastasia Laity, Joseph C. Jacob, Daniel S. Katz. Scientific Programming Journal, Vol 13(3), 2005, Pages 219-237.

section.title: Purpose
section.para: Pegasus WMS is primarily a NSF funded project as part of the NSF SI2 track. The SI2 program focuses on robust, reliable, usable and sustainable software infrastructure that is critical to the CIF21 vision. As part of the requirements of being funded under this program, Pegasus WMS is required to gather usage statistics of Pegasus WMS and report it back to NSF in annual reports. The metrics will also enable us to improve our software as they will include errors encountered during the use of our software.

section.title: Overview
section.para: We plan to instrument and augment the following clients in our distribution to report the metrics.
For the Pegasus WMS 4.2 release, only the pegasus-plan client has been instrumented to send metrics.
All the metrics are sent in JSON format to a server at USC/ISI over HTTP. The data reported is as generic as possible and is listed in detail in the section titled "Metrics Collected".

section.title: Configuration
section.para: By default, the clients will report usage metrics to a server at ISI. However, users have an option to configure the report by setting the following environment variables

listitem.para: A boolean value ( true | false ) indicating whether metrics reporting is turned ON/OFF
A comma separated list of URLs of the servers to which to report the metrics in addition to the default server.

section.title: Metrics Collected
section.para: All metrics are sent in JSON format and the metrics sent by the various clients include the following data

table.title: Common Data Sent By Pegasus WMS Clients

row.entry: the name of the client ( e.g "pegasus-plan")
start time of the client ( in epoch seconds with millisecond precision )
end time of the client ( in epoch seconds with millisecond precision)
the exitcode with which the client exited
the uuid of the executable workflow. It is generated by pegasus-plan at planning time.

section.title: Pegasus Planner Metrics
section.para: The metrics messages sent by the planner in addition include the following data

row.entry: the root workflow uuid. For non hierarchal workflows the root workflow uuid is the same as the workflow uuid.
the data configuration mode of pegasus
the number of compute tasks in the workflow
the number of dax tasks in the abstract workflow (DAX)
the number of dag tasks in the abstract workflow (DAX)
the number of the total tasks in the abstract workflow (DAX)
the number of input files in the abstract workflow (DAX)
the number of intermediate files in the abstract workflow (DAX)
the number of output files in the abstract workflow (DAX)
the number of total files in the abstract workflow (DAX)
the number of compute jobs in the executable workflow
the number of clustered jobs in the executable workflow.
the number of data stage-in jobs in the executable workflow.
the number of data stage-out jobs in the executable workflow.
the number of inter site data transfer jobs in the executable workflow.
the number of registration jobs in the executable workflow.
the number of cleanup jobs in the executable workflow.
the number of create directory jobs in the executable workflow.
the number of sub workflows corresponding to dax tasks in the executable workflow.
the number of sub workflows corresponding to dag tasks in the executable workflow.
the number of jobs that set the xbit of the staged executables
the total number of jobs in the workflow

section.para: In addition if pegasus-plan encounters an error during the planning process the metrics message has an additional field in addition to the fields listed above.

row.entry: the error payload is the stack trace of errors caught during planning

note.para: pegasus-plan leaves a copy of the metrics sent in the workflow submit directory in the file ending with ".metrics" extension. As a user you will always have access to the metrics sent.
